filteredArticles.headline: Saying goodbye to graduating seniors from every spring team
filteredArticles.subhead: Many senior athletes had their time on the field cut short
filteredArticles.abstract: The Penn Class of 2020 featured some truly outstanding athletes, many of whom had their careers cut short due to the coronavirus.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Ivy League cancels all spring athletic events for rest of the semester due to coronavirus

dominantMedia.title: Senior Athletes Graduates Spring 2020 Collage.png
dominantMedia.content: Top row (from left to right): Mark Evanchick, Christina Park, Gabby Rosenzweig. Middle row (from left to right): Jennifer Brann, Nia Akins, Peter Matt. Bottom row (from left to right): Sean Clarke, Dominique Williams, Ashley Zhu.

filteredArticles.headline: With hopes to play professionally, Peter Matt transfers to Duke
filteredArticles.subhead: Matt led the Ivy League in hits this season
filteredArticles.abstract: After his impressive career with the Quakers was cut short, Matt will head to the ACC to play for the Blue Devils for his final year of eligibility.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn baseball ace Christian Scafidi transferring to Notre Dame after graduation

filteredArticles.headline: Training from home poses numerous challenges for Penn football
filteredArticles.subhead: Most of the team's spring training was canceled due to the coronavirus
filteredArticles.abstract: Coming off a slightly disappointing season, the Quakers were looking to use spring training to prepare for the fall. Now, the players will train from home.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

dominantMedia.title: Brian O'Neill Football vs. Dartmouth.jpg
dominantMedia.content: O’Neill was one of two non-senior Quakers to receive All-Ivy honors for his performance this past fall.

filteredArticles.headline: Kristen Becker named new Penn gymnastics head coach
filteredArticles.subhead: Becker had an accomplished career as a gymnast and as an assistant coach at Penn
filteredArticles.abstract: After five years as an assistant coach, Becker takes over a talented team. Before coaching, Becker was a standout gymnast for the Quakers.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

John Ceralde resigns after nearly two decades coaching Penn gymnastics

New tight ends coach Ryan Becker couldn't stay away from Penn football

dominantMedia.title: 1-26-20_Gymnastic_vs_Rutgers_Kristen_Becker.jpg
dominantMedia.content: After being an assistant coach since August 2015, Becker (left) has now been chosen as head coach of the Penn Gymnastics team.

filteredArticles.headline: A coronavirus check in with Penn Baseball
filteredArticles.subhead: The Red and Blue had been picked as the preseason Ivy League title favorites for the first time in 25 years
filteredArticles.abstract: Before their season was cut short due to the coronavirus pandemic, Penn baseball was looking to have one of their best years in recent memory.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn spring athletes and coaches shocked and devastated after season cancellations

dominantMedia.title: Eduardo Malinowski Baseball.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Eduardo Malinowski ranked sixth in the nation with a .471 batting average.

filteredArticles.headline: An NBA comparison for every Ivy League basketball team
filteredArticles.subhead: The Ivy League has a long, rich basketball history that features many connections to the NBA
filteredArticles.abstract: The Ivy League and NBA both have their share of teams that are consistently winners, as well as teams that are perennial bottom-feeders.

filteredArticles.headline: Goldner and Evanchick drafted by Philadelphia Barrage
filteredArticles.subhead: Evanchick is only the second Quaker drafted in first two rounds
filteredArticles.abstract: Depsite being drafted, Adam Goldner intends to return to Penn for a fifth year to play lacrosse and add a concentration in Wharton.

RELATED:

Penn men's lacrosse's Connor Keating and Kevin McGeary selected in Major League Lacrosse draft

dominantMedia.title: MLax Adam Goldner Mark Evanchick.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Adam Goldner (left) and Mark Evanchick (right) will continue their lacrosse careers in Major League Lacrosse with the Philadelphia Barrage.

filteredArticles.headline: A look back at the most historic moments at Franklin Field
filteredArticles.subhead: Built in 1895, Franklin Field is the oldest football stadium in the entire NCAA
filteredArticles.abstract: Home to Penn football for 126 years, Franklin Field is one of the most storied and hallowed gridiron venues in the entire country.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

125 years of Franklin Field: The history of the oldest college stadium in the country

filteredArticles.headline: With her record-breaking college career over, Nia Akins looks to the future
filteredArticles.subhead: Akins set over a dozen records during her time at Penn
filteredArticles.abstract: As a result of the coronavirus ending her collegiate track career, Akins has begun training for the Olympics.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Second-place finish at Nationals just the beginning for Nia Akins

dominantMedia.title: Nia Akins Track and Field 3.jpeg
dominantMedia.content: Akins leaves Penn with eight program records.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn baseball ace Christian Scafidi transferring to Notre Dame after graduation
filteredArticles.subhead: Scafidi was the 2019 Ivy League Pitcher of the Year
filteredArticles.abstract: After most of his senior season was canceled, Scafidi has announced he will transfer to ACC power Notre Dame for his extra year of eligibility.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn's spring teams find unique ways to celebrate seniors despite season cancellations
filteredArticles.subhead: Women's lacrosse gathered to celebrate its seniors over Zoom
filteredArticles.abstract: Canceled seasons meant canceled Senior Nights, and the spring sports teams missed out on the opportunity to honor the players who had dedicated four years to their respective teams.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED: 

Ross | Despite its early end, my lacrosse career was my Penn identity

filteredArticles.headline: DiGrande | Is football worth the price?
filteredArticles.subhead: A decade after Owen Thomas' death, CTE is still a recurring issue
filteredArticles.abstract: We need to think critically about the benefits and drawbacks of both options: allowing the game to continue as is, injuries and all, while examining the consequences of eliminating the program altogether.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Margolis | Injury reminds us that some moments are bigger than football

When a Player Gets Up Dazed, Part I

filteredArticles.headline: Special guests and tight competition highlight first-ever Digital Penn Relays
filteredArticles.subhead: Former Olympian Carl Lewis was among the featured guests
filteredArticles.abstract: The five-hour event was streamed on Twitch and hosted by esports journalist Jeff Eisenband, with a number of guests joining him for interviews or to provide commentary.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn Athletics and Gen.G team up to launch livestreamed Digital Penn Relays

Penn Athletics announces cancellation of 2020 Penn Relays due to coronavirus

dominantMedia.title: Virtual Penn Relays 2020.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Although the Penn Relays were virtual this year, the unique energy of the event still shone through the screen.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn Athletics and Gen.G team up to launch livestreamed Digital Penn Relays
filteredArticles.subhead: Participants will compete at a replica of Franklin Field in Minecraft
filteredArticles.abstract: In place of the traditional Relays, which were canceled due to COVID-19, Penn Athletics has announced it will team up with esports giant Gen.G to broadcast a virtual edition of the event.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn Athletics announces cancellation of 2020 Penn Relays due to coronavirus

Growing eSports craze strikes Philadelphia as local team joins international league

dominantMedia.title: Virtual Penn Relays.jpg
dominantMedia.content: The Penn Relays will not be run at Franklin Field this year, but a digital version of the competition will be livestreamed instead.

filteredArticles.headline: Ryan Betley to transfer to California for last season of eligibility
filteredArticles.subhead: The Downingtown, Pa. native averaged 11.6 points per game this year
filteredArticles.abstract: The NCAA granted Betley an extra year of eligibility after he suffered a right knee injury in the first five minutes of his junior season, forcing him to missed the remainder of the year.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

A year removed from injury, Ryan Betley is healthy and ready to take on the Ivy League

In his final year at Penn, Ryan Betley is wearing the number he has always wanted

dominantMedia.title: Ryan Betley Transfer.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Senior guard Ryan Betley walks off the Palestra floor in what would be his final game for Penn men's basketball last month. He will spend his last year of eligibility at California.

filteredArticles.headline: Ross | Despite its early end, my lacrosse career was my Penn identity
filteredArticles.subhead: All spring sports were cut short due to coronavirus
filteredArticles.abstract: I’m grateful for every moment that this program has given me. I’m grateful for the opportunity that my coaches gave me when they let me come to Penn and for everything that they’ve taught me here.
filteredArticles.infobox:

filteredArticles.headline: NCAA announces spring athlete eligibility extension, but Penn athletes may not benefit
filteredArticles.subhead: Athletics Director M. Grace Calhoun leads the Division I Council
filteredArticles.abstract: As a result of the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, the NCAA Division I Council voted on Monday to grant spring-sport athletes an extension of their eligibility period.

filteredArticles.headline: Casey Brown hired as new head coach for Penn women's soccer
filteredArticles.subhead: Brown comes to Penn after coaching at Holy Cross for four seasons
filteredArticles.abstract: In its second coaching addition within a week, Penn Athletics announced on Monday that Casey Brown will be the new head coach for Penn women’s soccer.

filteredArticles.headline: Meredith Schamun hired to replace Iain Braddak as coach for Penn volleyball
filteredArticles.subhead: Schamun previously coached at Villanova for two seasons
filteredArticles.abstract: On Friday, Penn Athletics announced that Meredith Schamun will be the new head coach for Penn volleyball, the fourth person to take the job in the past five seasons.

filteredArticles.headline: John Ceralde resigns after nearly two decades coaching Penn gymnastics
filteredArticles.subhead: After five seasons as an assistant, Ceralde led the team for 14 more years
filteredArticles.abstract: After 19 years on Penn gymnastics' coaching staff and 14 years as the head coach, John Ceralde has parted ways with the Red and Blue.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn gymnastics captures first Ivy Classic title in five years after record showing

Penn gymnastics sends its seniors off with season-high team score in final home meet

dominantMedia.title: Gymnastics Coach John Ceralde 002.jpg
dominantMedia.content: It was announced on Thursday that John Ceralde (top, third from left) would be stepping down after 19 seasons with Penn gymnastics.
